articles.title: About me
articles.description: I study community ecology and the role of biodiversity in ecosystem stability. I work in coastal environments, with a current focus on coral reefs, although I've conducted research in salt marsh, oyster reef, mangrove, and desert ecosystems. I'm currently a first year PhD student in the Burkepile lab at UC Santa Barbara where I am studying the coral reefs of Mo'orea, French Polynesia. I love coding, data analysis, and thai food. If you have any questions or comments on what you see, please reach out (contact information on the Home page).

articles.title: Julianna Renzi

Julianna Renzi

          Code
          
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            Julianna Renzi
          
          
            
              I’m a PhD student at the University of California, Santa Barbara in the department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology. I study coastal ecology, with a focus on coral reefs and the role of biodiversity in ecosystem functioning.
            
            
              I’m a PhD student at the University of California, Santa Barbara in the department of Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Biology. I study coastal ecology, with a focus on coral reefs and the role of biodiversity in ecosystem functioning.
